subject: AccuWeather.com Alert(tm) Advisory  (avcavc)
body:
AccuWeather.com Alert[TM]






















 







							Severe Watches and Warnings for BEVERLY HILLS 













LOXNPWLOX
WWUS76 KLOX 092206
NPWLOX

URGENT - WEATHER MESSAGE
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE LOS ANGELES/OXNARD CA
306 PM PDT WED MAY 9 2007

..DENSE FOG EXPECTED THROUGH THURSDAY MORNING IN THE LOS ANGELES
AND VENTURA COUNTY COASTS...

A STRONG ONSHORE GRADIENT WITHIN A THIN MARINE LAYER DEPTH IS
CREATING DENSE FOG AT THE BEACHES CURRENTLY. DENSE FOG WILL
BECOME MORE WIDESPREAD TONIGHT AND CONTINUE INTO THURSDAY MORNING.
FOG IS EXPECTED BURN OFF THURSDAY MORNING.

CAZ040-041-100500-
/O.NEW.KLOX.FG.Y.0010.070509T2206Z-070510T1600Z/
VENTURA COUNTY COAST-
LOS ANGELES COUNTY COAST INCLUDING DOWNTOWN LOS ANGELES-
306 PM PDT WED MAY 9 2007

..DENSE FOG ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 AM PDT THURSDAY...

THE NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE IN LOS ANGELES/OXNARD HAS ISSUED A
DENSE FOG ADVISORY FOR THE LOS ANGELES AND VENTURA COUNTY COASTS.
THIS ADVISORY IS IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 AM PDT THURSDAY.

LOW CLOUDS AND FOG HAVE CLEARED TO THE BEACHES THIS AFTERNOON.
VENTURA HARBOR IN VENTURA COUNTY...AND MANHATTAN...HERMOSA...AND
REDONDO BEACHES IN LOS ANGELES COUNTY ARE REPORTING DENSE FOG
CURRENTLY. WITH A STRONG ONSHORE GRADIENT WITHIN A THIN MARINE
LAYER DEPTH...LOW CLOUDS AND DENSE FOG WILL BECOME MORE WIDESPREAD
TONIGHT.

DENSE FOG WILL IMPACT THE INTERSTATE 10 BETWEEN SANTA MONICA AND
DOWNTOWN...INTERSTATES 105 AND 405 IN WEST LOS ANGELES COUNTY...US
HIGHWAY 1 IN LOS ANGELES AND VENTURA COUNTIES...US HIGHWAY 101 IN
VENTURA COUNTY FROM THE CONEJO GRADE TO LA CONCHITA. DENSE FOG
COULD ALSO IMPACT INTERSTATE 110 BETWEEN SAN PEDRO AND DOWNTOWN
AND INTERSTATE 710 NEAR LONG BEACH.

DRIVERS ARE URGED TO USE CAUTION AS VISIBILITIES IN FOG CAN GO
FROM MORE THAN MILE TO LESS THAN SEVERAL HUNDRED FEET IN AN
INSTANT. SLOW DOWN...USE YOUR LOW BEAM HEADLIGHTS...AND INCREASE
YOUR FOLLOWING DISTANCE AROUND YOU.

A DENSE FOG ADVISORY MEANS VISIBILITY WILL FREQUENTLY BE REDUCED TO
ONE QUARTER MILE OR LESS. FOG CAN ALSO MAKE ROAD SURFACES SLICK
SO AVOID USING EXCESSIVE SPEED.

$$

HALL/SWEET
